text: Nevin Harrison (born June 2, 2002) is an American sprint canoeist.TeamUSA Profile She began canoeing at age 12 with the Seattle Canoe and Kayak Club.Seattle Canoe and Kayak Club She began competing for the USA at age 15, competing at the 2017 ICF Olympic Hopes Regatta in Račice, Czech Republic, winning silver in C-1 1000m, gold in 500m and gold in 200m in the 2002 age groupLocal Teens Shine at Olympic Hopes Regatta. The next year, at the 2018 ICF Olympic Hopes Regatta in Poznan, Poland, she won gold in C-1 500m and 200m in the 2002 age group. In 2019, she moved to the Gig Harbor Canoe and Kayak Racing Team in Gig Harbor, WA.Gig Harbor Canoe and Kayak Racing Team At the 2019 USA Team Trials in Oklahoma City2019 ACA Sprint and Para National Team Trials, she won senior and junior C-1 1000m, 500m and 200m. She competed at the 2019 Pan American Games in Lima, Peru and won C-1 200mDay 4 highlights Pan American Games 2019Canoeing at the 2019 Pan American Games. At the 2019 ICF Canoe Sprint World Championships, she won gold in C-1 200m2019 ICF Canoe Sprint World Championships results, becoming the first American to win a world championship in sprint canoeNBC Sports--Nevin Harrison wins sprint canoe world championship. ==References== Category:2002 births Category:Living people Category:American female canoeists Category:ICF Canoe Sprint World Championships medalists in Canadian Category:Sportspeople from Seattle Category:Pan American Games medalists in canoeing Category:Pan American Games gold medalists for the United States Category:Canoeists at the 2019 Pan American Games
title: Nevin Harrison
